author: KevinMarquette
body:
## PR Summary
- Add alias `Path` to the `-FilePath` parameter of `Start-Process`, `Set-TraceSource`, `Tee-Object`, `Trace-Command`,`Register-ScheduledJob`, `Set-ScheduledJob`,`Invoke-WSManAction`, `Set-WSManInstance`,`New-WSManInstance`
- Add alias `Path` to the `-BinaryPathName` parameter of `New-Service`
- Add alias `Path` to the `-DestinationPath` parameter of `Save-Help`
- Add alias `Path` to the `-SourcePath` parameter of `Update-Help`

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I think that aliases should be added _only_ to solve some specific scenarios - what is the scenarios? In all other cases, this may cause problems now or in the future when it is necessary to remove these aliases and this will be an breaking change.

/cc @SteveL-MSFT @daxian-dbw It is for PowerShell committee too. (#5816 )

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee reviewed this.  We would be concerned about making any general rules here, but reviewing the specific cmdlets listed we are ok with the proposed change.

comments.author: KevinMarquette
comments.body:
I added tests where the cmdlets already had some tests. Several of those cmdlets have no tests at all. I would like to work on some of those as a separate work effort.

I have a pull request out for the documentation of these changes.

title: Add Path alias to -FilePath parameters and others for several commands
